data.title: Utopian Literature in English: An Annotated Bibliography From 1516 to the Present
data.text:
2019 Tom, Nazbah. “Nameless.” Love After the End: Two-Spirit Utopias & Dystopias. Ed. Joshua Whitehead (Narol, MB, Canada: Bedside Press, 2019). Rpt. as Love After the End: An Anthology of Two-Spirit & Indigiqueer Speculative Fiction. Ed. Joshua Whitehead (Vancouver, BC, Canada: Arsenal Pulp Press, 2020), 147-165. PSt

The story takes place after a future World War in which many Diné were forced to serve while whole tribes moved underground to avoid the war. At the time of the story the Diné are beginning to lave their underground refuges, and the central characters are Diné calling others back home and one woman who is being called. The Native American (Diné/Navajo) author is a somatic practitioner living in Canada who uses the pronouns they/them.
